text.0: aŚvins what praise may win your grace who may be pleasing to you both.
text.1: how shall the ignorant worship you.
text.2: here let the ignorant ask the means of you who knowfor none beside you knoweth aught.
text.3: not of a spiritless mortal man.
text.4: such as ye are allwise we call you ye wise declare to us this day accepted prayer.
text.5: loving you well your servant lauds you.
text.6: simply ye mighty ones i ask the gods of that wondrous oblation hallowed by the mystic word.
text.7: save us from what is stronger fiercer than ourselves.
text.8: forth go the hymn that shone in ghoṣā bhṛgus like the song wherewith the son of pajra worships you.
text.10: hear ye the song of him who hastens speedily o aśvins i am he who sang your praise.
text.11: hither ye lords of splendour hither turn your eyes.
text.12: for ye were ever nigh to deal forth ample wealth to give the wealth that ye had gathered up.
text.13: as such ye vasus guard us well and keep us safely from the wicked wolf.
text.14: give us not up to any man who hateth us nor let our milchcows stray whose udders give us food.
text.15: far from our homes without their calves.
text.16: may they who love you gain you for their friends prepare ye us for opulence with strengthening food.
text.17: prepare us for the food that floweth from our cows.
text.18: i have obtained the horseless car of aśvins rich in sacrifice.
text.19: and i am well content therewith.
text.20: may it convey me evermore may the light chariot pass from men.
text.21: to men unto the soma draught.
text.22: it holdeth slumber in contempt and the rich who enjoyeth not.
text.23: both vanish quickly and are lost.
